etymologies: late Middle English: via Old French from Latin adoptivus, from adoptare ‘select for oneself’ (see adopt)

definitions: as a result of the adoption of another's child

examples.text: he is the adoptive father of his wife's three children

definitions: denoting a country or city to which a person has moved and in which they have chosen to make their permanent place of residence

examples.text: his adoptive home town of Rochdale

shortDefinitions: denoting place which person has chosen as their permanent place of residence
